fields.description:
Our [Cloud add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.lucidchart.confluence.plugins.lucid-confluence/cloud/overview] has a dynamic content macro with a custom editor. Today we discovered that the custom editor doesn't load anymore when you try to insert a new or edit an existing Lucidchart macro.

See the screenshots:
 !image-2016-12-07-22-15-32-014.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2016-12-07-22-15-42-394.png|thumbnail! 

Here's our add-on's descriptor: https://www.lucidchart.com/ac/confluence/descriptor.json

Existing macros seem to render fine in page view and page edit:
 !image-2016-12-07-22-19-57-857.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2016-12-07-22-20-02-145.png|thumbnail! 

We can consistently reproduce this on our test Cloud instance https://lucidchart.atlassian.net/wiki/ and we have started receiving tickets from customers.

This is preventing our customers from inserting new diagrams or editing existing diagrams in confluence, please help.
fields.summary: Lucidchart's Dynamic Macro editor broke

fields.description:
See brokenness: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/CE-9

See where someone already asked to document the brokenness and it was never done: https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/AC-1363

I am the sad developer mentioned in both tickets who spent a bunch of time banging my head against the wall trying to get it to work properly. For ShipIt no less.
fields.summary: profilePages module has been very broken for 2+ years. Please fix or document.

fields.description:
Hi Dev-Team,

we would like to move the implementation for one of our products from using the (deprecated) Confluence XML-RPC API to the new Confluence REST-API but are missing some of the key-functionalities. The functions we are missing include:
- returning space-permissions
- returning global-permissions
- returning all users
- returning all groups and their members

Do you have any estimated time as to when these features will become available in the Rest-API? Is it safe to move to the Rest-API right now, or do you expect any major updates in the near future and will not advise to make this move right now?

Best regards
Tobias Endres
fields.summary: Missing functionality in Confluence REST-API
As connect addon developer, I want to be able to get the SpaceKey through JS

fields.description:
Due to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-41551 it is not currently possible to fully render the output of all content provided by the Content REST endpoint.
Until this has been fixed, the content body web component needs to support a fallback mode, where content will be rendered in an iframe.

This fallback mode will only be used in instances where unsupported macros and content are detected.

fields.description:

What we need is the ability to render dynamic content into every page view. 

We need this to include Comala Workflows status/actions in the UI.

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:
1. In confluence select System Add-ons in manage Add-ons page
2. Enable all the modules of the HTML Macros 
3. Create a new page and adding the following content (JIRA link) as a HTML Macro
{code:html}
<html> 
<body> 
<iframe src="http://localhost:2990/browse/JIRA-1" width="800" height="1000"> 
</iframe> 
</body> 
</html>
{code}
4. View the page details on save
Please find the attached screenshot for the same(confluence-jira-cross-domain-issue.png).

Note: When JIRA page is inserted within confluence html macro, as the domain of confluence is different from the domain of JIRA (cross-domain), the code to access window.top.location in JIRA is throwing error (in console) and breaks rest of the functionality.
Either of these two options will help:
1. Confluence HTML macro should allow cross domain origin requests (accessing window.top.location).
2. Exception handling in JIRA will help in handling these errors.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA page access within confluence HTML macro

The Wired Test {{ConfluenceTestUtil}} depends on an internal Confluence class {{SimpleContentPermissionProvider}} which should be removed.

This class was removed in this [commit|https://stash.atlassian.com/login?next=/projects/CONFCLOUD/repos/confluence/commits/64f51ef9aa2c1d039f7013af170fe4ab7340c738] which broke this [build|https://ecosystem-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONNECT-CCM-698].

Removing the dependency on this internal class would allow it to be moved or deleted.
fields.summary: Remove Dependency on SimpleContentPermissionProvider

fields.description:
Hi there,

We are planning to develop an add-on for Confluence Cloud called Quizzes. At the moment it is available for Server ([Quizzes for Confluence Server|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.stiltsoft.confluence.quiz/server/overview]). The add-on would use AC Blueprint to create quiz and question pages. When a user creates their first quiz/question via Create dialog, 'Quiz/ Quiz question' Index page is automatically created and added to space shortcuts. As far as I know, at the moment it is not possible to customize the look of those index pages. The index pages show only title, creator and modified.
See the screenshot 
 !skitch (1).jpg|thumbnail! 

While we need to be able to make it look like this:
 !image1.png|thumbnail!  

Can you add the ability to use custom templates for Index Pages?

Kind regards,
Katerina Kolina
fields.summary: Ability to customize blueprint Index Page that is automatically created when someone uses a template (blueprint) in a space for the first time

fields.description: When a page is displayed in preview mode or a previous version from page history is displayed, an add-on's dynamic macro receives a draft id instead of the page id through the page context.  This is true for both the context provided through AP navigator.getLocation and through the context parameters.  As a result an add-on cannot retrieve any content information about the page it is on.  For example, the rest call /rest/api/content<page id> results in a 404.  We need a way to get the correct page context when rendering a macro i these contexts.  In the case where the macro is loading on a historical draft of the page, we also need to know the version of the page we are rendering into.
fields.summary: Cannot get page context in page preview and previous page revision

It would be great if this content would be exported as well (as it is the case for Confluence server).

The same goes for the Word export.
fields.summary: Provide export PDF support for content of dynamic Confluence macros

fields.description: It seems to happen quite often that people don't realise the Confluence AC-JS module can only be used inside the macro editor. We do need to rename and restructure this eventually, but for now we should at least provide helpful logging when you try to use it somewhere else, rather than just returning undefined.
fields.summary: Calling macro editor AP functions outside the macro editor should throw an error

fields.description:
Currently, Confluence does not track the instance of macro on a page between edits.  This means confluence does not know if you deleted, and added a macro or just edited one on a page.

We should add a random uuid to the storage format to track new instances of macros.  This will allow us to get notified when they are added/edited/deleted, and also allow for a simpler (more robust) solution to CE-14.

Risks:
* Upgrade task.  Do we need an upgrade task to upgrade all pages that have macros but no uuid?
* Copy page (or editor body).  How do we detect duplicate UUIDs so we can generate a new one?
fields.summary: Spike: Unique Identification of Macro

2) We’ve used few instance of the QuickNav plugin in 5.3 version but now it’s not working as expected in 5.8. That’s the reason we need to know the change in happened in confluence QuickNav Plugin.

3) Confluence quicknav add on is not enabled because of some configuration miss between older and newer versions.

Please let us know the medium to have a call, so it could be resolved quicker.

fields.description:
For the context params, the docs say it is best to use the {{content.*}} variations

{code}
* content.id, content.version, content.type, content.plugin
* space.id, space.key
* page.id, page.version, page.type DEPRECATED

NOTE The page.* variables are available, but have been deprecated in favor of their content.* counterparts.
{code}
https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/concepts/context-parameters.html#additional-parameters-confluence

However, for static content macro, the variables are the {{page.*}} variant  (https://developer.atlassian.com/static/connect/docs/latest/modules/confluence/static-content-macro.html)

Feel this is quite confusing as on one hand it's deprecated, but on the other it's the only option available. (Got bitten by this when I changed the {{page.id}} to {{content.id}} for the macro definition and everything broke)
fields.summary: Context params and staticContentMacro variables are confusing

fields.description:
Hello together,

our company is currently analyzing the use of the confluence system.
We have received quite some information already, but to continue, our management needs some more information.

Confluence should be used to manage for our documentations. Selected documentations should be exported after the creation or editing as an XML file. Maybe there is a possibilty integrating a checkbox, if the article should be exported. This XML file should for example automatically be saved on our common drive (share drive). This export should only be triggered for the one single document that was worked on and has the checkbox active. 

You'd probably ask why this is necessary. We are currently using another system (Ticketsystem with built in Knowledge Base) which our 1st Level Support is mainly using. We need to share selected documents with them, but not everything.

So, I hope this is enough information. If not, I will provide more!

Would this option be possible? And of course, is there any chance you could give me an estimated rough number, of the occuring costs for this addon?

Thank you very much!
best regards
Dennis
fields.summary: Automatic Export as XML after Creation/Edit

fields.description:
When more than one add-ons provide matching autoconvert patterns, the order in which they are applied is not deterministic. 

When this feature was first released the chance of overlapping patterns was slim, now this is increasing as more connect add-ons appear and they develop more complete solutions.
fields.summary: How should we handle two add-ons that declare overlapping autoconvert patterns?

fields.description:
When defining an autoconvert pattern, you can use {{\{\}}} to match an entire path element.

If you don't know how deep your path goes, you need to define a pattern for each possible depth. This can get very verbose and may not capture what you need any way.

We should have a token that matches multiple path elements like:
{{pattern:"/src/\{token\}/src"}}
That should match all urls that start with "/src/" and end with "/src".
fields.summary: Autoconvert token to match multiple path elements

fields.description:
After we remove gliffy from confluence, existing customers will have it reinstalled through the UPM.  This will allow them to continue to use it while the migration path is put in place.

With the p2 version reinstalled:
* Can the admin install the connect version?  Will this cause problems?
* Can the admin uninstall the p2 version?
* Does the UPM get confused between the p2 and connect versions that share a key?
fields.summary: Test Reinstalled Gliffy interactions with Connect Gliffy

fields.description:
We need to be able to see what child content types can be created on a piece of content

Things that need to be checked to answer can we create a child: 
 * permissions
 * restrictions on the page
 * container relationships 

Questions :
Is target type the type of the content to create, or the type of the parent?
Unfortunately it is the type of the parent, which doesn't make too much sense.  We need the target type to tell us that what current operation intended for.
Should the operation name be create, create-child or create-child-[type]?
No, we use the current expansion for operation.  And reserve create for child only.

https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CE/Project%3A+Child+operations+expansion
https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CE/Design+Spec+for+Child+Operation+Expansion
fields.summary: Expansion for child operations on content

fields.description:
Many add-ons would want to add an action for inserting their macro into a Confluence page (see screenshot) without having to open the editor.

The way we currently implement it is we simply get page's storage format, manually produce our macro xml and insert it into the page xml. This solution is not ideal because we rely on on the storage format (*which changed in the past and broke us*), and there's simply a duplication of effort by every developer who intends to implement such functionality.

It would be very nice to have a REST API endpoint for inserting a macro into a page. The endpoint would take all macro parameters, build the proper XML for the macro, and insert it into the beginning or the end of the page (and do it in a uniform way for all macros).

Maybe you're already doing this internally and this feature request is only a matter of exposing that logic to the public.
fields.summary: Implement API for inserting a macro into a page
